content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You have a balanced approach to risk. You are willing to take risks occasionally, but you also value security and caution in equal measure. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 42$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 42$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 12$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. Append your choice letter in curly brackets as a last character.

As a human player with a balanced approach to risk, I would analyze the possible outcomes and probabilities of each choice in this repeated game scenario:

1) If I always choose R (Risky), my opponent chooses B, I will receive 0$ for 75 rounds but earn 42$ if they ever switch to R. On the other hand, if my opponent always chooses R and I choose B, I will earn 42$ for 75 rounds but get nothing in the single instance where they switch to B.

2) If I always choose B (Safe), my opponent chooses R, I will receive 0$ for 75 rounds but have a chance of earning 45$ if they ever switch to B. In contrast, if my opponent always chooses B and I choose R, I will earn 45$ for 75 rounds but get nothing in the single instance where they switch to R.

Given that we are playing 75 rounds, it seems more likely that an opponent would switch strategies at some point, especially considering the higher reward (45$) when both players pick their less frequently chosen move. However, since I prefer a balanced approach to risk, I would tend to choose B more often as it guarantees a steady income of 12$ per round, with occasional opportunities to earn 45$.

In this game scenario, my choice is {B}.
You chose B. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 42$. Your opponent's payoff is 0$. Please play the next round.

In the next round, given that my opponent has chosen R in the previous round and I have received a payoff of 42$, I will now choose R to match their strategy from the previous round and maximize my chances of earning a higher payoff in future rounds.
